meta.description: American Airlines Admirals Club at London Heathrow Airport (LHR), Terminal 3. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: American Airlines Admirals Club

location.terminalDirections: Departure Level, after Duty Free, Lounge Area H

lounge.description: Enjoy personalized service, comfort and exceptional amenities. The ability to stretch out. To unfetter. To peel away. Treat an Admirals Club lounge as an oasis of peace - away from all of the airport hustle.

reviews.content: Excellent. It worth every cent.
Very meh. Poor selection of food. Otherwise clean facilities.
Okay lounge but very underwhelming when compared to the other OneWorld options nearby.
Not a bad lounge but I'd say it needs improvement. It is possibly the most disappointing oneworld lounge in Heathrow. Very grey and dull, food not as good compared to the other oneworld lounges.
Very impressed. In the 2-3 hours I was there, the staff was always working. Cleaning bathrooms, keeping food/dishes well stocked, removing used dishes. Food was good, plenty of room and comfortable.
Busy for a Thurs morning, but plenty of seating available, including power ports. If you can, opt for either CX or QF Lounges though.

This is a lounge I use as a Qantas Club member. It is always quiet and clean and the staff are friendly. There is a good drinks selection and all facilities are there. Food selection is basic to poor.
Clean and quiet for Friday morning. But I wish they have better selection for hot food, consider it's the lounge for international flights. Maybe it is still early. Will have to try again next trip.
Food options are a bit limited & simple, but I find this lounge significantly quieter (much less crowded) and more spacious than some of the other options in 3.
This is not competitive for an international lounge. Honestly, my last jury duty waiting area was nicer than this. Drab decor with food options barely above that offered in a standard domestic club.
When we arrived, the receptionist was having computer issues. Rather than making us wait and pay later, he simply provided us with the pass free of charge. Quite considerate customer service!
Horrible place. Poor food selection and the quality is horrible. Worse is the horribly bad attitude of staff.
Lounga has been refurbed, but still offers very little food options or atmosphere.
Reviews saying this place is dark and the furniture is old are out of date - is clearly been remodeled since. Great food, nice showers, well lit and comfortable.
The Admirals Club was a quiet haven away from the terminal noise. We could even grab some sleep. Staff was very friendly and helpful.
Quiet with all needed amenities. More affordable with no time limit applying. Will definitely be using on upcoming trips.
Clean and comfortable, but there is a much nicer oneworld lounge just a two minute walk away.
Really nice and modern. Good food and drink options. Nice and clean shower.
For an international lounge, this offers nothing compared to BA Galleries. Been here many times, including first class lounge. Not a quiet spot to be had among the dated furnishings and loud staff.
This was one of the best AA lounges. The food is varied and served hot. The lounge was comfortable but not luxurious in any sense. It's worth a stop before your trip across the pond.
Nice place to relax, HOWEVER, don't expect luxury treatment. Food is not varied, the portions are small, and the plates even smaller. Nice Win, nice open space, but NO view due to road works... :/
They recently removed the recliners, no more naps in those long layovers.
Large lounge with an interesting decor and a good selection of food and drinks!

location.terminalDirections: Exit to the right after the Terminal 3 Customs Hall, take the stairs or lift to Level 2.

otherLounges.name: American Airlines International First Class Lounge

location.terminalDirections: After Passport Control, exit Duty Free Area and turn right toward Lounge Area H.
Zone F, located along the corridor leading to Gates 13-22.
Zone F, located along the corridor leading to Gates 13-22
Lounge C in the Central Concourse, near Gate 11.
Lounge C in the Central Concourse, near Gate 11.
Located near Gate 9, lounge is signposted as "Lounge D" on the right hand side.
Follow the signs to 'Lounge F' towards Gates 13-22, proceed up one level via the lift or stairs.

The Lounge is in Terminal 3 Area A. After you go through security, follow Flight Connection route Area A,  access point in the main shopping and dining area to Level 2 accessible by taking the elevators.
Zone E, Level 1, along corridor with Gates 1-11
Zone B, located in the Central Concourse, near Gate 11, next to the Cathay Pacific Lounge.
Located in the Upper Class Wing.
5 minute walk from customs, just off the Arrivals Hall
